intro: Bolbitis phanerodictya, commonly known as the giant fern or the giant shield fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, leathery fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features a creeping rhizome with broad, shield-shaped leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. Its fronds are typically bipinnate, with a dense arrangement of small, oblong pinnae. Bolbitis phanerodictya thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks.
